head.title: Waking Up To the Promise of Spring

hedline.hl1: Waking Up To the Promise of Spring

block.p: THE surest signs that spring has arrived are daffodils and forsythia in the park and a fresh crop of warm-weather bedding. This season's beds are dressed in intense colors and bold patterns, sometimes mixed or overscale.

1. The Bulb pattern from Area comes in two color combinations: lavender and blue, above, and green and blue. A full-queen duvet cover is $165, a queen-size sheet is $85 and a pair of pillowcases is $60; (212) 924-7084 or arealinenshop.com.

2. Isaac Mizrahi's Butterfly Bedding is a duvet cover and pillow sham set in twin ($79.99) and full-queen ($89.99) sizes. Coordinating Dot sheet sets come in twin ($29.99), full ($39.99) and queen ($49.99). For locations: (800) 800-8800 or target.com.
3. Peony is another duvet cover and sham set by Isaac Mizrahi for Target, with coordinating sheets (prices and sizes, same as above).

4. Pine Cone Hill's Arabesque sheeting comes in sets with two sheets and two cases; a queen-size set is $204, and standard-size pillow shams with lace edging are $40 each. The Gypsy Velvet quilt in queen size is $370. For locations: (800) 442-8157 or www.pineconehill.com.
5. Bandana Paisley percale sheets are $28 to $60, standard cases are $30 a pair and comforter covers are $75 to $125; (800) 870-3513 or garnethill.com.

6. Tatami, a boldly patterned duvet cover from Designers Guild, comes in all sizes (queen size is $270). Izabal Aqua is a striped and embroidered sheet ($145 each for queen size); matching pillowcases are also available ($32 each). For locations: (800) 303-5413. At Gracious Home in Manhattan, (800) 338-7809.

7. Ankasa's Palm Beach bedding, inspired by 1970s Lilly Pulitzer style, is embellished with cording, embroidery and beading. A duvet cover in queen size is $665; a king is $795. A flat sheet in Egyptian cotton, detailed with smocking, is $198 in queen and $240 in king size. Standard size pillowcases are $55 a pair, and throw pillows are $385 to $525 each. Ankasa is opening a New York store in mid-May at 135 East 65th Street (Lexington Avenue); for other locations: (212) 575-1994 or ankasa.com.
